metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28733 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Integer underflow in grub_net_recv_ip4_packets; A malicious crafted IP packet can lead to an integer underflow in grub_net_recv_ip4_packets() function on rsm->total_len value. Under certain circumstances the total_len value may end up wrapping around to a small integer number which will be used in memory allocation. If the attack succeeds in such way, subsequent operations can write past the end of the buffer.

criterions.comment: grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-unsigned: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
